title: Nationwide POS Journey Management (GDS‑aligned)
context: Replace legacy POS journeys across ~11,500 branches with a modern, accessible system under GDS standards.
problem: Fragmented flows, complex device/peripheral integration, high transaction time, inconsistent error handling.
actions: Defined REST/JSON contracts, versioning strategy, error taxonomy; introduced contract testing.
Owned roadmap & MVP; structured epics around measurable OKRs (navigation time, transaction duration).
Ran weekly vendor alignment; mapped E2E flows to remove retries and redundant transformations.
impact: Reduced integration defects sprint‑over‑sprint; accelerated release cadence.
Improved counter‑staff throughput and UX; faster navigation and transactions.
challenges: Aligning multiple vendors with different SDLCs and definitions of done.
Balancing performance on low‑spec devices with accessibility requirements.
best_practices: Treat APIs as products: publish schema + changelog, deprecate predictably.
Adopt consumer‑driven contract tests to keep integrations honest.
Define 3–5 business KPIs and instrument them from day one.

title: AWS Operations Management Portal
context: Manual operations and disjointed tools slowed incident response and device/user management.
problem: No unified view of device health, authentication, or alerts across the estate.
actions: Designed an ops portal integrating secure authN/Z and device/user management.
Built Datadog dashboards for health, latency, and error budgets; set alert policies.
Delivered training and runbooks; phased rollout with feedback loops.
impact: Eliminated manual steps; materially faster incident triage and response.
Greater operational visibility; fewer repeated tickets.
challenges: Defining least‑privilege roles across multiple user groups.
best_practices: Define SLOs/SLIs per capability and wire alerts to ownership.
Create gold‑standard runbooks with embedded links to dashboards.
Ship thin slices to operations and iterate with real usage data.

title: B2B Lounge Check‑in SaaS
context: Modernize lounge check‑in across 1,600 lounges / 600 airports with peripheral and payment integrations.
problem: Legacy tools with limited data visibility; complex payment/peripheral stack.
actions: Captured requirements & NFRs; defined API/device/payment integrations.
Authored BDD stories; defined KPIs and Tableau dashboards.
Supported end‑to‑end testing and UAT with airline/partner stakeholders.
impact: Improved CX and operational reporting for partners.
challenges: Coordinating across airport security constraints and legacy systems.
Ensuring offline‑first flows for unreliable connectivity.
best_practices: Design for degraded networks; queue + reconcile patterns.
Use feature flags to pilot with select lounges before broad rollout.
Instrument partner‑specific funnels to spot regional friction.

title: Mobile POS, Contactless & Loyalty (Store Transformation)
context: Deliver new in‑store capabilities including mobile POS, contactless PED rollout and loyalty integrations.
problem: High checkout friction and fragmented in‑store journeys across payments and stock systems.
actions: Gathered requirements; authored use cases/activity diagrams and RTMs.
Coordinated payment/stock/CRM integrations and stakeholder training.
Piloted in flagship stores and scaled in controlled waves.
impact: Reduced checkout friction; improved compliance & traceability.
Established reusable integration patterns for future initiatives.
challenges: Synchronizing promos/stock across channels in near‑real time.
best_practices: Create a store‑tech design system for devices/peripherals.
Plan wave deployments with readiness checklists and rollbacks.
Close the loop with store staff through embedded feedback widgets.

title: Ops & CRM Digitization (D365)
context: Digitize critical operational workflows inside Dynamics 365.
problem: Manual handoffs and opaque process SLAs.
actions: Mapped as‑is/to‑be; automated logistics workflows in D365.
Defined Power BI dashboards for SLA monitoring and bottleneck detection.
impact: Improved operational efficiency and visibility across teams.
challenges: Adapting D365 constraints to bespoke processes.
best_practices: Build a service blueprint linking user steps to back‑office systems.
Instrument SLAs and visualize them where work happens.
